reviews.text: That is an incredíble market where you can find everything you need and with in the best quality. You can eat there since there are tables if you feel like it.
This will be my number one attraction. Love the noodle place. The crowds are bustling. It has loads of little markets. Wow.
This was one of the highlights of my time in Barcelona.  The smells all the different kinds of food you can grab a drink here and a bite there and it all is fresh. I went back a few times on my trip.
This is one of the best markets in Barcelona. The food is reasonably priced and everything is very fresh and tasty. Well worth a visit or two.

Avoid the crowds and head here for breakfast. Many of the stalls are still setting up but it is still lively and vibrant with some great food to taste (and buy). We visited in November so I suspect it could get unpleasantly crowded at lunchtime in the height of Summer. Nevertheless, an important place to "tick off' in "doing" Barcelona!

Wow , was not prepared for the vibrancy of the colours and the variety of different specialites on offer. Fish and shellfish I had not seen before you could buy and takeaway  to cook your self or eat cooked food on the spot. Very busy on  Saturday morning but well worth the visit.
Appreciated being able to buy small quantities of fresh fruits.

On the last day, decided to drop by to eat seafood, although we had our reservations! We were proven wrong.

Seafood is fresh and in front of you. Tried Sea Bream, Sardine and vegetables. All fresh, excellent and value for money. Service is also excellent.

Give a try and value for money. Can not go wrong if you like seafood
The market had a large number of fresh food stalls - meat, cheese, vegetables and fruit. The fruit was amazing - such a wide range of different fruits and beautifully arranged.
This market was typical of most markets in Spain. Colorful, lots of choices, great vendors, fresh food, good snacks and a lively environment.

Love this place. Full of amazing fresh food, oils, wine, snacks, sweets and areas to sit and eat. Great photo opportunities and staff are friendly at the stalls. Really enjoyed the market and would return!
Currently I live in Barcelona for 3 moths in the Centro area. What a lovely experience. The freshness is at the hand reach. Boqueria Market is a legendary place to visit.
Barcelona is one of the must see places..always fresh fruit and juices available..you won't see so much variety in many places...also have fresh fish and seafood
The the most famous market in Barcelona,but still worth a visit. Excellent displays of produce and great restaurants around the edge

This traditional market is located in the sea and beach La Barceloneta district of Barcelona. Plenty of fresh food, fruits and veg for sale and really useful if you're staying in the local for the beaches. As with most shops in Spain, most of the stalls are seem to close for the post afternoon snooze, but a couple of the cafe/bars stay open.
This is a marcket or mercado in Spanish, were you can find the best food. Fruits, meat, fish, everything has the best quality. Just to see things they sell is a real joy.
We as a family really enjoyed walking around the market with wide variety of produce from herbs, fruit, vegatables , meat, cured meat, fish, crustaceans etc. We did found a place to eat at as well
Fresh , healthy , live place. You can get fresh fruits. Very close to beach. You can find fancy coffe shops...

This is a market where you can get all you need while it's still fresh. That includes meat and fish products, fruit and vegetables as well as  a host of other lovely  and yummy things! It's a terrific place to do your shopping, particularly for the locals. You can also taste some of the goodies from several stalls which cook and prepare food for you.

Loved visiting the bustling market on route to the Plaça for a lunch stop. There are a couple of places you can sit and enjoy some excellent food. We stopped here and enjoyed some very cheap but lovely tapas in a place with a real buzz. Lots of interesting sights and sounds. Toilets here too for 50 cents.
The market is crowded but I liked it a lot.  I picked up some fruit that was super fresh and I ate it for the rest of my trip.  A very nice spot.
We loved the atmosphere. It was so crowded but it didn’t bothered us, we enjoyed visit. Best tapas and sangria that I tried in Barcelona! Just have to say m m mmmm! 😍

A so colourful place to begin your day at Barcelona!! It was something unexpected, but i loved this market.
There is colour everywhere, you can buy ready-to-go salads, juices, fruit salads, sliced fruits, candies, meat, bread etc. 
If you dont buy anything go there and take a photo of this rainbow open market
boqueria was a total show! colours, odors, agitation, diversity. a place where you can buy everything you want as food. you can also serve lunch there prepared. a place that should not be missed
The colors, the fruits and the atmosphere, I am in love with it.. Great variety of healthy food. It's a bit crowded so be aware of thieves.
This place is just great. You can buy everything you need. But despite shopping it is great place to visit with great ambience!
Delicious. Juices are cheaper in the middle of the market. So, avoid buying anything in the entrance.
Stunningly presented stalls of a huge variety of foodstuffs. Well worth a wander through even if you aren't hungry. Very photogenic.
This market has lots of things for eating. It is very colorful with delicious foods. Different fruits.
The prices are outrageous but definitely worth a trip to see the effort the merchants put into their displays each morning.  Do try a freshly squeezed fruit juice and/or a cone with ham and cheese.
Don't miss out on this market.  Not only is it beautiful to see, but the food they offer is great!  We took a little bit from several booths.  It is a really enjoyable, vibrant atmosphere!
Wonderful market in central Barcelona with quality produce and a wide variety of stalls. Fresh fruit, sliced meats and various spices are prominent.

We were frequent visitors to this market during our 5 day stay and fell in love! Yes, it was busy but it made for a fantastic atmosphere. The Magdalene chocolate muffins were sooo good as was the granizado de limon. Its a must to visit during your adventures!!

Such a fun place to kill some time - delicious pasteries, fruit, nuts, wine and chocolates in great atmosphere. Loved picking up some picnic food here and heading to the beach. And make sure to say "Ola!" to legendary Juan at the Pinotxo. Worth the trip!
Wow what a find..... It's amazing ..... like everything is delicious and great to walk round. We bought ice creams.

Do not miss out on this market, whatever you do! It’s located in a covered area with plenty of food options within the market or the surrounding area. We walked by this market each day several times. Try the juices and smoothies!

We stumbled upon this market and enjoyed the market. You can buy about anything to eat you’ll ever imagine here. Tons of crazy food!!! Lots of places to eat and sample local foods. There a few gift type shops as well.

This market is one of my most favorite places in Barcelona. All kinds of fresh food. I especially like these small fresh juices, they're quite expensive, but so good, while my stay in Barcelona I had at least one per day. Also you have to allow for a big amount of people, but that kinda belongs to places like this one.
We walked through this market first of arrival in Barcelona. It remained a focal point of the rest of the 3 days we were there.

A great local market, offering a huge selection of fish, meats, fruits and vegetables. even if you do not want to buy any food, it is worth a visit to experience the sights and smells of local cuisine.

Is it me or the fruit drinks are not fresh but from cans? The taste from one vendor to another is so consistence in look and taste (too sweet). The real juice bars back home have juice press upfront and I see fresh juice being made, but not here… 

The overall market is color and fun, a must for most tourist. However I find some of the shop prices close to the entrance costs more and less attentive.

Be careful of cashiers not giving you back change or correct change. One of the shop cashier took my $50 and pretends to be busy with other customers and held on to my money without giving us changes back, only after she served few customers I have to ask for my change that’s when she say she will and she was just busy. Really? she served 3-4 customers and take their money and give changes to them but you were to busy and forgot about me?

Best market I have been to in Europe! It’s really cheap. 
Lots of fruits, sweets and meat. You can sit there and eat and have drink. We went there on a Saturday morning and it wasn’t crowded at all.

Located in the Barcelonetta district.
Nice selection of food for every day or for a picnic at the Barcelonetta Beach.

Right next door is the famous bakery Forn de Pa Baluard.
You can't miss it.  There is always a line-up outside...

This is. Large market with many places to buy fruits, vegetables, meats and fish to cook or ready made to eat outside the market. They also have a few sit down counters and the food there must be great because they are always full. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience
A must-see for anyone with a special interest for food and cooking. A really nice introduction to Catalonian cuisine: raw ingredients and ready-made foods. Don't miss the empanadas.

Whether stopping in at El Quim for a meal or at any of the other food stalls or market stands the Barcelona Market (AKA Mercat de la Boquria) is a worthy diversion for those looking for a slice of Catalonian culture, the location adjacent La Rambla no doubt gathering it’s fair share of tourists but most of the shoppers still local including many Chefs stocking their restaurants in the early morning.
Great way to spend time walking around and seeing all the local foods in one place. So much to see and taste. It is a bit crazy busy but that can add to the fun. Amazing photo opps.

MArket of everything

Fresh food : checked
Fresh fruit : checked
Fresh sea food : checked
Freash  meat and variations : Checked
Beer : Checked. 
War freindly katalan people : Checked :)

This market have so much to see that is crazy, fresh almost anything. We walk inn and took us hours before we left. From all nuts selection, fruits & veggies, fresh seafood and a lot more. You cant miss this place. Is a little crowded so be prepare BUT is part of the experience. I found there a lactose free buffalo cheese, Im not lactose free but someone important is and that gift was the best he could ever have.

Despite having visited Barcelona several times, this was the first time that we had actually ventured into this large fresh food market. We virtually had to fight our way through the crowds, as it was just full of shoppers. It was a very hot day and with so many people in the market area, it was quite uncomfortable in there.
Despite the crowds and the discomfort, we managed to have quite a good look around. There were splendid displays of foods of all types. Most of it looked very tempting and delicious.
Very much worth a visit but do try to choose a time when it is unlikely to be full of people. You may need to make some enquiries to find out when this would be!

open air market

you can buy 
meats , ice cream, fresh juice, seafood, spices, fruit and everything in-between 
very cool place to walk around, there are tons of mini food stand inside + beer tasting etc, there is just a lot of new modern Barca Cuisine inside

This is a nice market in the Barceloneta neighbourhood. Not very crowded and with a lot of locals dining in the cafe inside the market. Everything was in Catalan so have your translator ready. Lots of fresh produce and meat. We ate at El Cafe del Mercat inside and had an early lunch of paella (while everyone else was still having their coffees and croissants!).

It's a beautiful market. Tourists have to see Barcelona. It's a popular place. Vegetables. Fruit, fish, delicatessen. 
But it's not a big market. 
For example Mısır Çarşı and Grand Bazaar. There are much bigger markets in Istanbul.
If you went to Barcelona you should see this market. It's not a big market. But it's a cute market.

Great place for a look around, but gets ridiculously busy so go early. As it is also expensive, I would suggest buying no more than a snack and having a wander.
Unfortunately, but understandable with the multicultural crowds, the Catalan attitude is well and truely on display with many vendors.
If you want to actually buy food, I would suggest Mercat de Santa Caterina via Jaume 1 Metro
Nice market but limited products for sale. Very busy due to it's location. Good quality food for sale

There is a bar and restaurant overlooking the placa but in the corner of the market on the other side by Carrer de la Maquinista is a small cafe. Four of us tried the lunchtime menu, only €10 each for simple starter, main and dessert. Yes, it's only €10 so don't expect anything fancy, but it was good food freshly cooked, probably sourced from the market and by far the best value for money all week. A choice of about 6 starters, lentil salad, gezpacho and habitas con jamon stand out. Also about 6 main courses to choose from, salmon steak was the favourite.

This is a must see in Barcelona. If your a food lover, this is heaven on earth.  From the chocolates and marzipan to the fresh meat,  produce and cheeses this was the most amazing market I have ever seen.  Make sure you enter with an empty stomach as you will want to sample everything!
A very busy market, heaps of different kinds of food to pick, if you like sampling different things this will be a good place to go.

One of the first sights I got to experience in Barcelona was this market.  After cautiously walking down the pick pocket happy infamous "rambla," we finally arrived.  The bright lights, colors, and smell draws you in.  Here they sell almost everything and anything - Fresh rabbit, sausages, cheeses, vegetables, meats, seafood, and even live turtles.  While our eyes were bigger than our suitcases, we managed to purchase small amounts of meats & cheeses to bring back to the cruise ship for enjoyment.  The rest of the offerings were just cool to see, experience, and take photos of.  Prices were reasonable and the service friendly.

a place with many taverns, stalls with fresh fish, fruits
a perfect place for tapas
the place is full
it must be seen

It dosen't get better then this. To buy your own favourits and a bottle of wine and just sit down and eat. 
Here you Can get absolutly everything. Never miss it when in Barca.

This place is amazing! There are so many great places where you can eat, juice bars, loads of fresh fish and seafood. I'd love to have a place like this nearby. It's great for tourists and locals alike.

Setting aside all the tourist 'juice bars' there are a lot of great deli's selling aged cured meats and it's worth a walk through to check out the fresh seafood, cheeses and spices.  There are a lot of locals that give it an authentic feel.  Check out Pinotxo Bar for a great meal, it's reviewed on it's own in Tripadvisor.  Pretty busy and tight, so I would not bring young kids.
Wonderful little market~ have different variety of things~ €1 juice is wonderful for a hot summer day~

This is an open market filled with every kind of food you can imagine! There are small shops each with each own specialty- spices, meats, fruits, vegetables, sea food..,the list is endless. The market is very crowded which makes it difficult to walk through. I would keep children very close it would be easy to get separated. This is a place you should visit!
I guess this is a real wow for people who don't have farmers markets but it's just meat, candy and fruit juice. Fine is you are already in the area but don't make a special trip

This market offers a great place to eat and taste local cuisine as well as local culture. Great place to buy Spanish souvenirs, especially for your foodie friends. A lot of the stands do close at midday so if you want to see it at its best go around 10:30 an and plan to have lunch there.

The market was recommended to us by the hotel manager as one of the more fun and busy places to visit, especially if you're going to be on La Rambla anyway.

While it was very busy (and seems as though it would be regardless of time) there was also plenty of room to stop and look at any stall, you didn't feel you would be swept along in the crowd.

Piles upon piles of fresh fruit, smoothies, gelato, fish, meat (even an excellent sushi stall right at the back!) and sweets litter the stalls and all are interesting to have a peek at.

If you are anywhere near the La Rambla strip or even further afield, I highly recommend a wander around here.

Definitely one of the most interesting markets I've ever seen. If you want to try local cuisine you really should go there. Our little ones were excited because of so many colours and shapes they saw there.
The place is incredible if you want to try local cuisine,wide range of seafood,fruit and fresh vegetables.It's closed on sundays and is just couple of steps away from the famous La Rambla😍
From vegan fallafals to fresh goats head, you can see it here.  Lots of tasty things to sample for €1 to €5 each.   The chocolate right by the entrance from las ramblas is a bit overpriced.

Walking into this market I was in absolute awe, and after travelling to some other markets in Europe I haven't found anything that has compared. It is incredible the amount of goods, tables, vendors and people that have been crammed into this small building, but it is worth every second to visit, especially those from North America. Being Canadian, I had never seen anything like this in my life. I was also able to purchase some of the best tasting pineapple in a cup with a fork for next to nothing. Walk around, as some vendors sell the same things but the prices are cheaper or more expensive depending on where you are in the market. Come hungry, and leave full!

Visited this market several times while staying in Barcelona and absolutely loved the selections of fruits, vegetables, meats, seafood items laid out to choose from.  We had some of the best meat from a local butcher in there, that with vegetables from another vendor, provided us with a wonderful dinner!

There were an amazing amount of stalls selling fresh meat, fish, fruit and vegetables,  spices, sweets plus sandwich bars too. It had a great vibrant atmosphere there and we wandered about for quite a while. We purchased some great fresh food from there.

A great place to try all of Barcelona's offering some. From fresh fruit to seafood and everything in between you won't be disappointed by this market. It is very crowded even first thing in the morning but not more so than any other market. However, if freshly butchered meat of all kinds turns your stomach you might want to eat elsewhere before visiting (luckily we did not have this problem! But another member of our group did. Grab a freshly squeezed juice and roam around until you find the perfect snack or even meal!
If you're ok with intense smells of meat and fish accompanied by large crowds, this market is worth seeing. The best part is the vibrant colors of the fruit stalls.
We had tons of fun going through the Mercat in Barcelona.    They had a huge variety of fish, meats, vegetables, etc.   A must see while in Barcelona.
This marketplace is a must when in Barcelona! Go there hungry and don't be afraid of the crowd. If you like tropical fruit or chocolate, you'll love it.

This is a great market where you can loose an hour looking at all the fresh local produce while also trying some top quality food. Try and blend in with the locals as here you will see them eating some of the freshest sea food you will find.

Very busy market which can get quite crowded but is worth a visit if you are on La Rambla.  There is a great selection of fresh produce including fruits, fresh fruit juice, vegetables, cheese, meat, fish and eggs.
You can literally get anything you need here from fresh fruit juices to full course meals. A must see when you visit Barcelona
You have to stop in to feast your eyes on the colourful; fresh produce in this market. Variety galore. I especially enjoyed the did fruits section. You'll be spoilt for choice.
A great place to pick up some really fresh food and drink, lots of little place to pick up tasty tapas, fresh cuts of meats and really tasty seafoods!

Lots of everything.  Fish, meat, produce..nuts..you name it...loved the juices!
Many food stands as well.  Crowded...but lots of fun. Since you are in Barcelona, beware of pickpockets!!!  A wonderful activity when walking the Ramblas. A must see in Barcelona.

This is a great market in Barcelona on Placa de la Font and should not be missed and should not be confused with Bouquerie on La Rambla, which is even better. There is a large selection of produce and small good, fish and meats. There is a small historical museum adjacent that is also worth a visit.

This is really a must do in Barcelona.  The market is beautiful and fun to wander through.  The abundance of fresh fruit is quite amazing and delicious.  It's also a really good place to pick up some nice gifts to take home (olive oil, spices etc).  Recommend.

Really lovely market with lots of options to buy fresh produce or eat on site. Tapas bars and other assortments of snacks are on offer. Good prices considering it is a very popular market and a tourist attraction. We paid €2 for fresh juice. It is crowded but enjoyable at the atmosphere is bustling. Felt very safe - just keep all valuables close to you and use common sense so your not a target in crowded location. Easy to get to from the Metro stops on Las Ramblas.

This mercat in the heart of Barceloneta is not crowded with tourists. Moreover close to the Placa de la Font-entrance is a small exhibition telling the story about how this mercat and Barceloneta was hit by severe Italian and Nazi-German air attacks and bombs during the civil war.
Great place to visit in the morning-noon time for some refreshing fruit juice, and empanadas! If you have an apartment, definitely do some shopping for fish, meat, and much more!!!

If the Mercat de la Barceloneta were the only one in town I would recommend but as Barcelona has 50 more covered markets and a bunch of them much better of this in space, quality, choice, I do not recommend this. My favourites are Santa Caterina, El Ninot, la Concepciò, l'Abaceria and, of course, la Boqueria.

Absolutely loved this market a must see to have fresh Joyce and fresh fruit a absolutely incredibly cheap prices. Plenty of bars for fresh tapas of seafood and anything else you desire. Went everyday my favourite place in Barcelona

This is a great market to walk around and pick up a few items (fresh fruits, drinks).  If walking Las Ramblas, it is a great place to pop into to look around.  All the foods, colors and smells are amazing.

Markets like these are some of our favorites, and this one did not disappoint! Be sure to grab a cone of ham (try all!!), a cone of yummy seafood, juices, and candy. This is a great place to get souvenirs for loved ones - who doesn't like getting yummy treats??

Come here to indulge in lots of treats, or grab a few snacks.

This is a nice little touristy and local market in Barceloneta, not to be confused with the Mercat de Sant Joseph de la boqueria just off Las Ramblas, which is the must see Market in Barcelona

This is a smaller interesting spot, but certainly not indicative of the big market.

Found out about this place from guide book. Please do not expect authentic place, spot was made for tourist, but that doesn't mean it is not good. I can say I liked choice of smoothies (best for me was papaya-coconut from center booth), juices, fruits and sea-food. Prices are adequate to place (have some extra for exterior)

As we were staying 4-nights in an efficiency, we went to stock up on provisions. Fruits, vegetables, eggs, meats, fish, seafood, cheeses, breads, sweets - all super fresh and reasonably priced. Didn't see anyone bargaining so I didn't either. Even if you are not buying, wind your way through the throngs (or go at 10am when it is not crowded) to check out the sights, it's worth the time. Recommended.

Definitely worth going to visit but please don't just look and then leave. Purchase gifts for family or yourself but don't be the tourist who just goes to look and then never purchases anything because it hurts the local vendors.

My 4th visit to the city and everytime I have made it a point to come to this place. Just off the La Ramblas,  this market is a delight for all senses. The bright colored fruits and veggies, the aromas of the fresh produce, the sound of stalk owners calling you out..it all is a delicious cornucopia.

Great place. You can purchase all kinds of fruits, exotic vegetables,  meats, sea food and other stuff like dry fruits, preserves etc. Lovely little market. Gives you a distinct Catalan feel. 

Must visit place. Even if you are here for a 15 minute round.

We stumbled upon the market intending to go the next day which we did as well
Wonderfull place great atmosphere plenty of food to try & look at
Everything from tasty smoothies & fresh fruit bowls to beer & wine with tasty delicacies 
Stalls with so many variety show of mushrooms & eggs
To aged beef & fresh fish & shellfish
Deli meats & hams to sweet treats & coffee
It was good to experience this large local market. Plenty of room to wander around.  No restaurants inside but plenty in the vicinity.

The atmosphere is not very cozy, lacks cafe's or restaurants, more caters the locals for food shopping than visitors for spending time. The park outside has bars and restaurants, fills with locals on evenings and weekends and has a nice small playground for kids.
